intro: Thalictrum punctatum, commonly known as the spotted meadow-rue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and typically grows in moist, woodland habitats. The plant features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its flowers are usually arranged in loose, upright inflorescences and bloom in early to mid-summer. Thalictrum punctatum is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, providing nectar for pollinators.
